title: Highest Fossil Fuel Dependency
description: In 2022, Algeria's fossil fuel energy consumption accounted for 100% of its total energy use, indicating a complete reliance on fossil fuels.

title: Strong External Debt Reserves
description: As of 2023, Algeria's total reserves were 1110.24% of its total external debt, showcasing a robust financial buffer against external liabilities.

title: High Youth Literacy Gender Parity
description: In 2019, Algeria achieved a youth literacy gender parity index of 1.23, reflecting a balanced literacy rate between young males and females.

title: Minimal Market Capitalization
description: In 2018, the market capitalization of listed domestic companies in Algeria was only 0.19% of GDP, indicating a relatively underdeveloped stock market.

title: Low IBRD and IDA Loan Dependency
description: Algeria's dependency on IBRD loans and IDA credits was minimal in 2016, with a total of $725,000, suggesting limited reliance on international financial institutions.

title: Minimal Debt Service Burden
description: In 2023, Algeria's public and publicly guaranteed debt service was only 0.19% of its exports, indicating a low burden of debt repayment relative to its export earnings.

title: Low Primary Education Expenditure
description: In 2023, current education expenditure on primary education was just 1.40% of total expenditure in primary public institutions, highlighting potential underinvestment in primary education.
